seoul.name: Seoul Special City
seoul.desc1: The capital and largest metropolis of South Korea
seoul.desc2: Seoul is in the northwest of South Korea.

incheon.name: Incheon Metropolitan City
incheon.desc1: Designated as Korea's first free economic zone

daejeon.name: Daejeon Metropolitan City
daejeon.desc2: Located in the central region of South Korea

sejong.name: Sejong Special City
sejong.desc1: A de facto administrative capital of South Korea.
sejong.desc2: Surrounded by the Chungcheongnam-do, and Chungcheongbuk-do

busan.name: Busan Metropolitan City
busan.desc1: South Korea's second-most populous city after Seoul
busan.desc2: Located on the Southeastern tip of the Korean Peninsula.

ulsan.name: Ulsan Metropolitan City
ulsan.desc2: Ulsan is the industrial powerhouse of South Korea.

daegu.name: Daegu Metropolitan City
daegu.desc1: The third-largest metropolitan area in the nation
daegu.desc2: Daegu sits in a basin surrounded by low mountains.

gwangju.name: Gwangju Metropolitan City
gwangju.desc1: The sixth-largest city in South Korea
gwangju.desc2: Gwangju is in the southwest of South Korea.

jeju.name: Jeju Special Self-Governing Province
jeju.desc1: The island lies in the Korea Strait.
jeju.desc2: Home to South Korea's tallest mountain, Mt. Halla.
